definition: to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: An air-raid alarm sounded in the depths of night.
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报响时，城市的灯光就熄灭了。

sentences.english: When the air raid occurred,they hurried to the safety.
sentences.chinese: 空袭发生时，他们急忙跑到安全的地方。

sentences.english: An air strike killed five people in a mosque as dusk fell.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏时一次空袭打死了清真寺里的5个人。

sentences.english: The city was ablaze with light, and not a single air-raid alarm sounded .
sentences.chinese: 市内灯火辉煌，听不到一声空袭警报。

sentences.english: The air-raid alarms were frequent and means for Members getting about scarce.
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报频繁，议员们的生活所需渐感缺乏。

sentences.english: He says many people are leaving Dobley for fear of another air strike.
sentences.chinese: 许多人担心会发生另外的空袭，正在离开多波雷。

sentences.english: Owing to the danger of air raids, all civilians must vacate from the city.
sentences.chinese: 由于空袭的危险，所有老百姓均须撤离市区。

sentences.english: During the attack two Royal Australian Naval vessels, Kelat and Mavie, were sunk.
sentences.chinese: 空袭中澳大利亚皇家海军舰艇克拉特和玛威被击沉。

sentences.english: The commander decide to make an airstrike on the enemy's supply line.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官决定空袭敌人的补给线。

sentences.english: There were several alarms during the night but no actual air raid took place.
sentences.chinese: 当夜，空袭警报拉响了数次，但并没有飞机来袭。

sentences.english: It sounds like an air raid siren.
sentences.chinese: 那听起来像是空袭警报。

sentences.english: The air raid alarm sent people running to their home hastily .
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报使人们纷纷往自己的家跑区。

sentences.english: French bombers had made the first air strike of the no-fly resolution.
sentences.chinese: 法国轰炸机完成了禁飞决议后的第一轮空袭。

sentences.english: It is unclear if Karzai has the power to order an end to such strikes.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔扎伊是有权力命令停止这样的空袭还不得而知。

sentences.english: Army in the attacks on the Gaza Strip after several rounds of air strikes.
sentences.chinese: 以军在袭击事件后对加沙地带发动数轮空袭行动。

sentences.english: The air-raid alarm went on drilling away from the gate.
sentences.chinese: 从大门不停地传来刺耳的空袭警报。

definition: to blow up/to destroy with explosives
